title: Tracking Issue for `-Z remap-cwd-prefix`

labels.name: T-compiler
labels.description: Relevant to the compiler team, which will review and decide on the PR/issue.

labels.name: C-tracking-issue
labels.description: Category: A tracking issue for an RFC or an unstable feature.

labels.name: A-cli
labels.description: Area: Command line interface to the compiler.

body:
This is a tracking issue for `-Z remap-cwd-prefix` which rewrites absolute paths in the current directory to the given value.
* Docs: https://doc.rust-lang.org/nightly/unstable-book/compiler-flags/remap-cwd-prefix.html
* Implementation: #87320
* Original issue: #87325
* MCP: https://github.com/rust-lang/compiler-team/issues/450

### About tracking issues

Tracking issues are used to record the overall progress of implementation.
They are also used as hubs connecting to other relevant issues, e.g., bugs or open design questions.
A tracking issue is however *not* meant for large scale discussion, questions, or bug reports about a feature.
Instead, open a dedicated issue for the specific matter and add the relevant feature gate label.

### Unresolved Questions

* [ ] What is the relationship with [RFC 3127](https://github.com/rust-lang/rfcs/pull/3127)?
* [ ] Will this always be defined to be the same as `--remap-path-prefix=$(pwd)=VALUE`?  That is, what gets remapped? Debug info, backtraces, compiler macros, coverage data, etc?  What will happen if RFC 3127 results in separate mapping flags?

### Implementation history

* #87320
